info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 7 at 3:49PM CDT until July 7 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following county, Clay.
* WHEN...Until 745 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 347 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to an isolated thunderstorm, with at least 1 to 2 inches of rain having fallen within the last 45 minutes in parts of the Advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Additional rainfall up to around 1 inch is possible over the next hour or so. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Big Sandy Creek, Little Sandy Creek and Buffalo Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fairfield, but mainly rural areas just north and northwest of town. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT THIS EVENING
